messages.subject: New collector needs help in Tucson AZ
messages.msgSnippet: Please pardon the cross-posting, most of you will probably get (at most) three copies of this. A client of mine in Tucson AZ has been given a Japanese sword by
messages.messageBody:
Please pardon the cross-posting, most of you will probably get (at most)
three copies of this.

A client of mine in Tucson AZ has been given a Japanese sword by a friend of
his. From the description it would seem to be in WWII mounts with a leather
combat cover, though it may have a partly civilian tsuka. My client is a
knowledgeable collector, but this is his first nihonto. He has ordered
several books and seems interested in knowing more, at least about this one
sword.

He was able to get the mekugi out but has not had the handle off, so we're
not sure if it's a bar-stock blade or the family Koto heirloom.

I'm sure I've met someone from Tucson at one of the shows, but a look
through my card file drew a blank. Anyone in the area willing to help out,
please get in touch with me directly with your contact info at
craigharris@... and I'll pass your info on to him.

DON'T hit that reply button.

Thanks!

Craig L. Harris Bridge of
Dreams, LLC
Books from and about Asia o: 847 696-9774
<http://www.bridgeofdreams.com/> www.bridgeofdreams.com
c: 847-846-7701



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
